26.83.text:
Welcome to Eldridge &
Company. Two years ago

28.83.text:
voters in the fifteenth council
district in Central Bronx,

32.27.text:
the district that includes
the communities of Belmont,

35.34.text:
Fordham, Tremont and East
Tremont, elected this young

39.17.text:
member to the New
York City Council.

41.24.text:
I'm not sure though that at
the time they thought this

44.54.text:
young man, Ritchie Torres,
would then become one of the

47.31.text:
council's most
important leaders. But he did.

50.22.text:
And he's my guest
today. And welcome.

52.22.text:
>>>RITCHIE TORRES: It's
an honor to be here. Thank you.

54.22.text:
>>>RONNIE ELDRIDGE: I'm
so delighted to have you.

56.22.text:
Were you born a
political being?

58.29.text:
>>>RITCHIE TORRES: Growing
up my aunt would tell me

61.43.text:
that you talk too much.
You should be an attorney.

65.83.text:
>>>RITCHIE TORRES: But in
the beginning I had dreams

67.83.text:
of becoming a teacher. I
would teach my cousins

69.84.text:
history and mathematics.
And then in high school I

74.31.text:
engaged in a form of legal
debate known as moot court.

76.58.text:
So it's modeled after the Q &
A structure of the Supreme

79.41.text:
Court and we delivered an
argument in the face of

82.12.text:
rigorous and relentless
questioning from judges.

84.72.text:
And in the final round of
my moot court competition I

86.75.text:
had an opportunity argue before
three judges of the Second

89.69.text:
Circuit Court of Appeals so it
was a life changing experience

93.09.text:
for a young high school student
from the inner cities.

95.63.text:
But then my first introduction
into politics came with the

100.33.text:
Coro program. So Coro was
a program that specializes

103.67.text:
in leadership development.
And I was part of the

did they find you or how

believe my law coach

2003 or '04. 2004 so it

>>>RITCHIE TORRES: It

>>>RONNIE ELDRIDGE: That's great

that was the beginning of

151.79.text:
the trajectory that ultimately

154.52.text:

I became an intern in the

156.72.text:

local, my local council member

161.36.text:
Jimmy Vacca. I then eventually

164.10.text:

168.84.text:
>>>RONNIE ELDRIDGE: What did
you, what do you like about it?

172.24.text:
>>>RITCHIE TORRES: What
I love about politics is first I

174.41.text:
prefer to be a generalist.
You know if you're a doctor you

177.18.text:
can only focus on medicine.
If you're a teacher you can

179.65.text:
only focus on education.
When you're an elected official

183.55.text:
you can focus on every
aspect of human welfare.

186.92.text:
So it's just endlessly
intellectually stimulating

190.76.text:
and you can experience both
the macro on the micro so one

193.53.text:
day I'm in a public housing
apartment inspecting mold

196.36.text:
growth and the next day
I'm holding a city council

198.87.text:
hearing and cross examining
the NYCHA chair about mold

202.80.text:
in public housing. And so
to be able to experience the

205.84.text:
macro and the micro;
constituent services and policy,

209.34.text:
in the span of a week
or day is fulfilling.

213.18.text:
>>>RONNIE ELDRIDGE: But
it's also under current,

215.65.text:
why are you doing it? Is
it because you personally

220.15.text:
like it or do you
have a mission?

222.26.text:
>>>RITCHIE TORRES: I am a
man on a mission.

224.26.text:
And I do, I mean, I you start
with the premise that

227.09.text:
government can and should
play a role in improving

229.26.text:

am a product of public

233.63.text:

236.97.text:

transit, but for a public

240.14.text:
hospital system, our
public housing system,

242.68.text:
I grew up in public housing
and so preserving those

245.88.text:
institutions as a foundation
for upward mobility is

249.32.text: the central cause of my life.

252.49.text:
>>>RONNIE ELDRIDGE: And
you're very interested in

254.49.text:
passing along that passion
to younger people.

257.09.text:
>>>RITCHIE TORRES: I
am. I feel you know civic

259.09.text:
engagement is a little
like learning a language.

261.39.text:
The best time to do it is
when you're young.

264.63.text:
It's a habit that you should
cultivate at a young age

266.70.text:
so that it remains with
you. And I've seen the,

270.40.text:
really the destructive
impact that the crisis of

275.08.text:

our society. You know,

277.98.text:
I do come from a borough
that has one of the lowest

280.05.text:

My district, the last two

283.98.text:

311.14.text:

you know I represent a

313.98.text:

317.55.text:

322.62.text:
the problem is low voter

does it cause the

I represent a district where
you know maybe a hundred

342.88.text:
sixty five thousand residents

349.32.text:

352.82.text:

355.49.text:

360.36.text:

367.97.text:

There was a vacancy yeah.

when in doubt vote

743.44.text:
